<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning </strong>on an incredibly busy news day. Before we get to that, some congratulations are in order: Arnulfo Narro and Ana Narro each won MacBook Pros courtesy of the Brew’s giveaway. If you didn’t win this time around, stay the course—we’ll be running another laptop raffle in the fall. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We also wanted to take a moment to recognize our wonderful interns on this National Intern Day. Sierra, Diane, Amanda, Cynthia, Kate, Becky, and Tres. We have no idea how tall you are because we’ve never actually seen you in person, but we’re grateful to have you on our team. </p>

Remember, this is looking at data from the three months when you basically didn’t do anything at all, so output is </span><span><a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/07/29/u-s-gdp-nations-economy-likely-shrank-35-annual-rate-q-2/5530223002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expected to drop</a></span><span> a stunning 35%.</span>

We’ll have more from the Fed a little bit further down the newsletter.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/29/big-tech-ceos-grilled-antitrust-hearing?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Yesterday’s Day of Days
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Big Tech under the microscope " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTI1L2JpZ190ZWNoX3VuZGVyX3RoZV9taWNyb3Njb3BlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It happened. Yesterday, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, Google CEO Sundar Pichai, and Apple CEO Tim Cook <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/live-updates/google-facebook-amazon-apple-antitrust-subcommittee-house-judiciary/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were trotted out</a> (with help from Cisco Webex) in front of the House Judiciary's antitrust subcommittee. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So that you don’t have to experience six hours of grandstanding and bizarre interior decor, here’s the tl;dwbcihal (too long; didn’t watch because I have a life). </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">No. 1. Dem lawmakers’ gloves are off </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Subcommittee Chair David Cicilline, Rep. Pramila Jayapal, and Rep. Val Demings all asked the CEOs spiky questions. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Jayapal grilled Zuckerberg over whether Facebook copies competitors in order to smoke them out. She cited a quote from Instagram cofounder Kevin Systrom, who expressed concern that Zuck would go into “destroy mode” if Instagram refused Facebook’s acquisition offer. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">No. 2: Tech CEOs think their markets are plenty competitive </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Or at least, that's what they tell congressional committees. The four CEOs swore up and down that their sectors are as competitive as a cheerleading championship in a teen drama. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“We compete hard, we compete fairly, we compete to be the best,” </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/07/29/apple-google-facebook-amazon-congress-hearing/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quoth</a></span><span> Zuck, whom we suspect just started </span><span><em>The Last Dance</em></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tim Cook defended the App Store's steep fees by talking about the competition to attract developers. "Essentially, it's so competitive I'd describe it as a street fight for market share in the smartphone business." </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">No. 3: Conservatives believe tech is against them </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Republicans including Rep. Jim Sensenbrenner, Rep. Jim Jordan, and Rep. Matt Gaetz all questioned Zuckerberg and Pichai about whether their platforms discriminate against or suppress conservative voices. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Rep. Jordan kicked things off in his opening statement with a fiery, “Big Tech is out to get conservatives.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And...congressional committees aren’t above shouting matches. At one point, Rep. Jordan interrupted Rep. Mary Gay Scanlon after Scanlon referred to Jordan’s allegations as “fringe conspiracy theories.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Contempt for Big Tech has clearly become bipartisan in the U.S. Congress, but often for very different reasons. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>these companies will be out of the headlines for maybe about 25 minutes before roaring back. They all report earnings later today. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EARNINGS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/29/spotify-shopify-report-better-expected-numbers-q2?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's a Great Day to Be S_ _ _ify
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you have a green logo, are headquartered in a snowy country, and “-ify” something, chances are you had an epic Q2. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Shopify:</strong> The Canadian e-commerce platform reported a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/29/shopify-shop-q2-2020-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">97% annual increase</a> in revenue in Q2, and the total amount of spending on Shopify <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/f62d84fd-895a-4474-acb4-389d88bb19da?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">now exceeds</a> rival eBay. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With shares up nearly 100% over the past six months, Shopify is now the most valuable company on Canada’s stock exchange by a healthy margin. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Spotify:</strong> Overall podcast consumption <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/7/29/21346339/spotify-q2-2020-earnings-podcasts-coronavirus-covid-19-consumption-recovery?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than doubled</a> in Q2 (shoutout<em> </em><a href="https://open.spotify.com/show/7nc7OQdPTekErtFSRxOBKh?si=GgIWeY5ZSk-mxH6PE-XUCA&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Business Casual</em></a>) and paying subscribers grew 27% year over year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Also: </strong></span><span>Michelle Obama, who signed an exclusive distribution deal with Spotify a few weeks ago, debuted her podcast yesterday. Her first guest happens to have the same last name. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Shopify’s e-commerce ecosystem and Spotify’s growing podcast empire show that the COVID-crash experienced by most companies can actually be a tailwind if shifting consumer habits favor your core business. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Is Day Trading the Best Way to Spend a Day?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/26/day-trading-maybe-not-best-way-spend-day" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Motley Fool" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMTA0Ni8xNTk1ODc2MzY4LU1vdGxleUZvb2xfQnJhbmRlZENvbnRlbnRfU2Vjb25kYXJ5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6ImNvbWV0LW1vcm5pbmdicmV3IiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The rise of day traders has been documented everywhere from Twitter to our virtual brunch with Pop Pop. As volatile markets continue, many amateur investors have looked to this strategy as a way to get rich quickly. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And like we reminded Pop Pop over homemade crepes, investing is for the long-term. That’s why we’ve put together this <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/26/day-trading-maybe-not-best-way-spend-day" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">handy article with our friends at The Motley Fool</a> to discuss the possible pitfalls of day trading. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So if you’re thinking about getting involved in some day trading, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/26/day-trading-maybe-not-best-way-spend-day" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">read our article</a> first and take just a moment to think about your goals for the future. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve been saying “Decades Not Days” into the mirror every morning, but that’s not mandatory. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/26/day-trading-maybe-not-best-way-spend-day" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out the article here</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/29/nasas-perseverance-rover-set-launch-mars?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Thing's Going to Mars
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="NASA's launch site" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTIzL25hc2Ffc19sYXVuY2hfc2l0ZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>NASA/Joel Kowsky</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Depending on how hard you went during the antitrust hearing, you could be reading this before or after NASA launches its Perseverance rover to Mars (the launch window begins at 7:50am ET.) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>Because <em>Mars</em>, that’s why. Perseverance <a href="https://mars.nasa.gov/files/mars2020/Mars2020_Fact_Sheet.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will collect</a> rock and soil samples to determine whether there was ancient life on the Red Planet. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fun fact: It won’t actually be taking those samples back home to Earth; another mission will collect them in 2028 at the earliest. If we’re still doing MacBook Pro giveaways then...</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Another goal of this mission is to test technology for future colonization of Mars. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">More details</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Landing ETA: </strong>February 18, 2021, at Jezero Crater, Mars</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">Mission duration: </strong>After landing, the rover will spend at least 687 Earth days (one Mars year) on the planet.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The rover itself: </strong>It’ll come with 13 onboard computers, 23 cameras, seven onboard experiments, and, with a top speed of one-tenth of one mile/hour, it’s <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/nasa-to-launch-its-most-ambitious-mars-rover-yet-11596027106?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three times faster</a> than any other Mars rover out there.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
THE FED
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How Diverse Is the Federal Reserve?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Federal Reserve can feel distant from our day-to-day lives. In fact, we’re betting you have a better chance of naming the <em>Survivor</em> Season 13 winner than the president of the Reserve Bank of New York. But in the end, it’s the Fed’s nitty-gritty work (not Yul Kwon’s) that keeps our economy functioning, especially during these times of economic crisis. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And as the body responsible for crafting monetary policy, the Fed employs some of the most powerful economic leaders in the country. So how do they reflect the broader U.S. population? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Brew analyzed the race, gender, and educational background of Federal Reserve leadership, from the chair down to the regional banks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What we found: </strong>At the national level, Federal Reserve leadership remains predominantly white, male, and Ivy-educated. But as you spread out across the 12 regional reserve banks, a more diverse portrait emerges.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here's a little taste...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTI0L2ZlZF9sZWFkZXJzaGlwX2RpdmVyc2l0eV9jaGFydC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24ifQ==" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="" data-reactroot=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/29/diverse-federal-reserve?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Now go read the whole thing</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Brew's Bookshelf
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="books" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC82ODIvYnJld19zX2Jvb2tzaGVsZi5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every other week, we’ll bring you a few of our favorite business-related reads. Tomorrow marks the end of Disability Pride Month, but conversations around disabled identities, disability justice, and inclusion shouldn’t stop there.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9781984899422?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Disability Visibility</em></a> is a collection of stories, essays, and other texts curated and edited by activist Alice Wong that celebrates and documents the lived experiences, power, and culture of the disabled community. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780807019290?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Being Heumann</em></a> is the memoir of renowned disability rights activist Judy Heumann, who became a national figure in the ‘70s after suing NYC for denying her a teacher’s license. In the decades since, she has championed disabled rights in the U.S. and around the world. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://bookshop.org/a/9879/9780807022047?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>A Disability History of the United States</em></a> by Kim Nielsen retells American history with disabled people at the center, tracing how ideas of disability have influenced American identity from Native American tribes pre-European settlement to the late 20th century. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can check out the full list of our reading recommendations at the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/extras/bookshelf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Brew's Bookshelf homepage</a>.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if !mso]><! -- -->

<!-- <![endif]-->


<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
So You Want to Hit 4 Million Listens?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’ve come to the right place: The Brew's podcast <em>Business Casual just</em> hit that milestone. With 4m downloads under our belt, I want to share some of what we’ve learned.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Never be afraid to hear the word “no.”</strong></span><span> I’ve been after guests like Barbara Corcoran and Ray Dalio for months. Sometimes you just have to aim big and ask—what’s the worst that could happen?</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">This pandemic has made all of us more meta. </strong></span><span>Since the crisis began, I’ve listened to business experts become increasingly aware of the world around them. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Trust your gut. </strong></span><span>Grappling with unpredictable listener behavior, our team decided to double down on what we do best: </span><span><span style="text-decoration: line-through;">make fun of VCs</span></span><span> make sick episodes. It worked.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>

Remember, this is looking at data from the three months when you basically didn’t do anything at all, so output is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/2020/07/29/u-s-gdp-nations-economy-likely-shrank-35-annual-rate-q-2/5530223002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpected to drop\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e a stunning 35%.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFed: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe central bank finished up its meeting with a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-fed/fed-repeats-pledge-to-keep-u-s-interest-rates-low-idUSKCN24U2VB?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003econtinued pledge\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to keep interest rates near zero for as long as necessary to support the flailing economy. We’ll have more from the Fed a little bit further down the newsletter.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTECH \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/07/29/big-tech-ceos-grilled-antitrust-hearing?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nYesterday’s Day of Days\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Big Tech under the microscope \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xOTI1L2JpZ190ZWNoX3VuZGVyX3RoZV9taWNyb3Njb3BlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt happened. Yesterday, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos, Google CEO Sundar Pichai, and Apple CEO Tim Cook \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbsnews.com/live-updates/google-facebook-amazon-apple-antitrust-subcommittee-house-judiciary/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere trotted out\u003c/a\u003e (with help from Cisco Webex) in front of the House Judiciary's antitrust subcommittee. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo that you don’t have to experience six hours of grandstanding and bizarre interior decor, here’s the tl;dwbcihal (too long; didn’t watch because I have a life). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNo. 1. Dem lawmakers’ gloves are off \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSubcommittee Chair David Cicilline, Rep. Pramila Jayapal, and Rep. Val Demings all asked the CEOs spiky questions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eJayapal grilled Zuckerberg over whether Facebook copies competitors in order to smoke them out. She cited a quote from Instagram cofounder Kevin Systrom, who expressed concern that Zuck would go into “destroy mode” if Instagram refused Facebook’s acquisition offer. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNo. 2: Tech CEOs think their markets are plenty competitive \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOr at least, that's what they tell congressional committees. The four CEOs swore up and down that their sectors are as competitive as a cheerleading championship in a teen drama. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e“We compete hard, we compete fairly, we compete to be the best,” \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/07/29/apple-google-facebook-amazon-congress-hearing/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equoth\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Zuck, whom we suspect just started \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Last Dance\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTim Cook defended the App Store's steep fees by talking about the competition to attract developers. \"Essentially, it's so competitive I'd describe it as a street fight for market share in the smartphone business.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNo. 3: Conservatives believe tech is against them \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRepublicans including Rep. Jim Sensenbrenner, Rep. Jim Jordan, and Rep. Matt Gaetz all questioned Zuckerberg and Pichai about whether their platforms discriminate against or suppress conservative voices. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRep. Jordan kicked things off in his opening statement with a fiery, “Big Tech is out to get conservatives.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd...congressional committees aren’t above shouting matches. At one point, Rep. Jordan interrupted Rep. Mary Gay Scanlon after Scanlon referred to Jordan’s allegations as “fringe conspiracy theories.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eContempt for Big Tech has clearly become bipartisan in the U.S. Congress, but often for very different reasons. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ethese companies will be out of the headlines for maybe about 25 minutes before roaring back. They all report earnings later today. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse:
